description: A large and iconic macaw with a brilliant blue back and wings, a golden-yellow chest and belly, and a white facial patch with lines of small black feathers.
temperament: Highly intelligent, social, and can form very strong bonds with their owners. They are playful and enjoy being the center of attention, but require consistent training to prevent nipping.
loudness: Very Loud. Their call is a powerful, harsh screech that can be heard from a long distance. They will use it to communicate and get attention.
vocalization: Excellent talkers with the ability to learn a large vocabulary of words and phrases. Their voices are typically very clear.
dietaryNeeds: Require a diet higher in fat than many other parrots. A high-quality pelleted diet should be supplemented with a variety of nuts (like walnuts, macadamias, and almonds), fresh fruits, and vegetables.
healthPointers: Can live 60-80+ years. Prone to feather plucking if bored or stressed, Proventricular Dilatation Disease (PDD), and overgrown beaks. They need plenty of hard toys to chew.
housing: Requires a very large and durable cage, at least 48"W x 36"D x 72"H. An outdoor aviary is ideal. Absolutely not suitable for apartments due to their size and noise level.
lifespan: 30-50+ years (some live 70+ years with excellent care)
activityLevel: High energy and very active. Requires extensive daily exercise, climbing, and foraging activities. Needs 4-5 hours out-of-cage time for physical and mental stimulation. Destructive if under-stimulated.
socialNeeds: Extremely social and demanding. Forms intense bonds requiring substantial daily interaction. Can become aggressive or develop severe behavioral problems without consistent socialization. Not suitable for owners with limited time.
noiseTolerance: Extremely loud - unsuitable for apartments or noise-sensitive settings. Ear-piercing screams that carry long distances. Vocalizes primarily morning/evening but can be noisy throughout day when excited. Neighbors within 100+ feet will hear.
spaceRequirements: Large cage minimum 48"W × 36"D × 60"H. Needs heavy-duty construction (14-gauge wire or thicker). Requires dedicated bird room or very large space. Play stand and multiple perches essential. Will destroy furniture and belongings if not properly managed.
timeCommitment: 3-4 hours daily minimum for interaction, training, exercise, and enrichment. Extensive time for cage maintenance, food prep (fresh chop daily), and behavioral management. Lifetime commitment spanning decades.
